message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.SY. 

The paper proposes a new design for distributed ledgers that optimizes for data availability and shifts responsibility for executing and validating transactions to clients. This suggests that the paper may belong to the categories of cryptography (cs.CR), distributed computing (cs.DC), data structures and algorithms (cs.DS), databases (cs.DB), or systems and control (cs.SY). However, given the focus on consensus and data availability, cs.CR and cs.DC are the most likely categories.
